Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in credibility findings, ignored central evidence, or improperly relied on extrinsic evidence
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed refugee status due to abuse and threats in Nigeria
Court_Ruling: Allowed judicial review; decision quashed and remanded for re-determination
Defendant_Behavior: Board questioned credibility based on inconsistencies, failed to consider cultural context, relied on unverified extrinsic evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution under IRPA
Assessment_Factor: Credibility, cultural context, reliability of documents, use of extrinsic evidence
Procedural_Issue: Lack of procedural fairness in assessment
Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant lacking credibility due to perceived inconsistencies
Relief_Sought: Quashing of Boardâ€™s decision, new hearing
Governing_Rule: A Convention refugee must have a well-founded fear of persecution
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider cultural context and key documents
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm due to abuse and threats in country of origin
Cause_Description: Applicants faced abuse and threats in Nigeria and sought protection
Evidence_Handling: Board improperly relied on unverified extrinsic evidence
Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions regarding fair refugee determination
Evidence_Issues: Unverified extrinsic evidence used; central evidence ignored
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient consideration of documentary and contextual evidence
Decision_Rationale: Decision was patently unreasonable due to flawed credibility analysis and improper use of evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on unverified evidence, failure to assess key documents
Legal_Standard_Applied: Patent unreasonableness standard on judicial review
